intro: Hieracium paraleucum, commonly known as the white hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its pale yellow to white flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Hieracium paraleucum is often found in open habitats and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
